summary.position: Postdoctoral Position in Software Engineering and AI for Sustainable Food Choices
summary.department: Software Engineering section of the Maersk Mc-Kinney Moller Institute (MMMI)
summary.focus: Designing digital nudging tools to promote sustainable consumer behavior in food choices
summary.start_date: 1 August 2025 or as soon as possible thereafter
main_responsibilities: Conduct research on AI-driven nudging tools
Evaluate the effectiveness of digital nudging approaches
Support project management and coordination across the consortium
qualifications_required: PhD in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a closely related field
Strong software development and programming skills
Research experience in artificial intelligence and/or machine learning methods
Experience with data-driven user modeling and AI-driven personalization
Ability to work collaboratively in an interdisciplinary team
application_guidelines: Read SDU’s guidelines on how to apply
Upload documents as specified in the application procedure
